pros: Good fellows to work, very supportive fellow

pros: Nothing good to say here
cons: Admin doesn’t enforce academic Dishonesty policy. Student cheat. Professors give Fs and then admin “asks” them to allow student to retake the test. Half the student fail because they are underprepared for college. Professors are asked to analyze their grading and expectations. Instead of seeing that the students are the issue, admin has faculty take training to be more “understanding” and “sympathetic” toward underprivileged students. DEI is promoted.

pros: Great students who want to learn and achieve

job_title: Tenured Full Professor in Albany, GA
pros: Absolutely none. Their sole purpose is to recruit more students to make more money and secondary purpose is to graduate then regardless of whether or not they learned anything.
cons:
This is a completely unethical “university.”
Students are allowed to blatantly cheat. When professors call them out on it, all the student has to do is go complain to the professors supervisor and then the professor is told to let the student redo the work. ASU simply wants to pass a higher number of students to make their graduation rate look appealing so professors have to lower the bar and are pressured to pass, pass, pass the student if they do anything at all in class. Their degree is a complete joke and these kids are not prepared for the real world at all. They are being cheated out of a good education bc they’re not held responsible when they should fail.

pros: Benefits, Leave(Sick-Vacation), Helping students, Various job duties
cons: Compensation, Multiple job duties, Location

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Albany, GA
pros:
-Best professors to work with in the chemistry field, especially Dr. Ghislain Mandouma
-The amount of help given to the students is more than enough to give them a great career path
cons: Only downside of working at ASU is having to leave. It was one of the best experiences I could have asked for before entering into my career field.

pros: beautiful campus, supportive colleagues, generous resources
cons: upper admin-mandated 5/5 teaching load is unsustainable for faculty

pros: Work hours a great and met great people
cons: Pay was ok but they were going through a management so things where everywhere

pros: Standard benefits, regular work schedule, low cost of living

job_title: IT Student Worker in Albany, GA
pros: I enjoyed working with people who are like minded and helpful.

job_title: Access Service Representative in Albany, GA
pros: I enjoy working here, and the opportunity provided allows me to grow in my own chosen field. I used the tuition assistance program (TAP) to obtain my MBA, which I believed contributed to my career goal.
cons: Creating opportunities to retain staff by aligned degrees obtained using TAP to fill open new positions.

review_title: I loved working for Albany State in the Department of Information Technology! Everyone is family!
pros: Family environment. Active always and fun.The set-up is very open and some days you can see hundreds of students and others you can see only a few. Traveling around campus on a go-cart fixing problems and documenting your work. That's about it.
cons: Not a big salary paying job! Non student workers get paid more but still not making a ton.

pros: relaxed working environment; easy access to working areas; relatively decent weather climate; clear focus on teaching responsibilities with limited paper work.
cons: disjointed administrative approach; ineffective strategies and planning for short and long term goals. Many administrators are not qualified for the positions they serve in.  Bias hiring and promotional practices.

pros: Some of the people that work at ASU are wonderful and really care about the university
cons: Some of the people that work at ASU are awful and have no sense of community.

review_title: Not the best place to work
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Albany, GA
pros: It is a laid back place and the costs of living a lower than the national average.
cons: I worked so hard for very little money.  The people at the top want work done for them but do not care about the advancement of their workers.

cons: Few cultural activities available.  You will have to visit nearby cities like Atlanta, Tallahassee, or Gainesville
